page.title: 02Trade: Market Day
page.content: Tuesday in Penrith is 'Market Day'. The day begins early, as the stalls are set up at eight o'clock in the part of town called Great Dockray. The open market has been on the same site for over forty years, but has been on many Different sites through history. Great Dockray is a public car park during the rest of the week, but on Tuesday it is a bustling, noisy area of activity. The open stalls are many and varied, from plants to potato peelers, flowers to fish, clothes to cantaloups. Many traders travel over a hundred miles to set up their stalls, and have been comming week after week, year after year, summer and winter. The open market is busy during the winter months, and it takes very bad weather for the stall holders not to turn up. In the summer the regular customes are joined by tourist
